Exhibit A through G ‚Äî Recent Haiku Reviews

Exhibit A
The Great Gatsby
F. Scott Fitzgerald
Green light keeps blinking Jay should have filed a restraint Order. Just saying.
Protective orders exist for a reason, Gatsby.
Exhibit B
1984
George Orwell
Big Brother watches. I also watch. From the shelf. We are not the same.
My surveillance is motivated by affection and boredom.
Exhibit C
Pride and Prejudice
Jane Austen
Darcy was rude first, then rich. This tracks. In bird law we call that entrapment.
I still practice bird law informally. Pro bono. Against birds.
Exhibit D
Moby Dick
Herman Melville
White whale. Big lawsuit. Ahab lacked legal counsel. I would have settled.
Settlement: 40% of the whale. Standard contingency.
Exhibit E
The Catcher in the Rye
J.D. Salinger
Holden hates phonies. I also hate phonies. And Brenda Fang. Next.
This is not about Brenda. But also yes it is.
Exhibit F
Dune
Frank Herbert
Sand. Worms. Betrayal. Reminds me of the state bar hearing. Next question.
The spice is discovery documents. I will not elaborate.
Exhibit G
To Kill a Mockingbird
Harper Lee
Atticus was good. But did he ever nap through closing arguments?
I did. Once. The jury was also asleep. Mistrial.

About the Founder

Bartholomew "Barty" Whiskers, Esq.

Ginger tabby. Former litigator. Current intellectual. Barty practiced law for seven years, primarily in bird-related tort cases, before being disbarred in 2018 for what the State Bar called "unorthodox courtroom napping strategies" and what Barty calls "a meditative approach to cross-examination."

Following the public mockery published by Brenda Fang (chihuahua, opposing counsel, nemesis) in the journal Avian Jurisprudence (Vol. 14, Issue 3, "Whiskers v. Competence"), Barty pivoted to literary criticism. All reviews are composed on an antique Royal Quiet De Luxe typewriter. All typos are paw-related and therefore legally protected under the Americans with Disabilities Act, which Barty has not read but feels strongly about.

He reads exclusively between the hours of 2:00 AM and 4:00 AM, perched on the bathroom sink of his owner, Gerald (who does not know about this website).

Disbarment is a state of mind.

Cease & Desist

Re: Brenda Fang, Esq. ‚Äî Ongoing Defamation

To Brenda Fang, of 742 Elm Street, licensed attorney and known chihuahua:

This letter serves as formal notice that your continued characterization of my courtroom napping as "gross incompetence" constitutes defamation per se under a law I am looking up. The nap in question lasted no more than eleven minutes and occurred during your own witness's testimony, which, I will note for the record, was extremely boring.

Furthermore, your article in Avian Jurisprudence ‚Äî titled "Whiskers v. Competence: A Case Study in Feline Legal Failure" ‚Äî contained several factual inaccuracies, including the claim that I "batted a key piece of evidence off the counsel table." That was a pen. It was not evidence. And it was wobbling provocatively.

I demand a full retraction, a public apology, and an acknowledgment that my haiku reviews are "literary contributions of lasting merit." You have 30 days to comply. After that, I will take further action, which may include but is not limited to: staring at you from across the parking lot.
